Present O
BT O
Openreach O
( O
British O
Telecom O
) O
BT O
Openreach O
is O
responsible O
for O
looking O
after O
the O
local O
network O
( O
connection O
from O
your O
property O
to O
local O
exchange O
) O
that O
makes O
the O
running O
of O
telecommunication O
services O
possible O

. O
BT O
helps O
to O
provide O
lines O
for O
telephone O
connection O

. O
It O
has O
products O
like O
PSTN O
, O
Ethernet O
, O
NGA O
, O
and O
LLU O

. O
BT O
acts O
as O
an O
intermediate O
between O
customer O
and O
connection O
provider O

. O
BT O
Openreach O
is O
a O
software O
module O
which O
manages O
BT O
business O
right O
from O
the O
placement O
of O
the O
order O
, O
managing O
appointments O
, O
monitoring O
status O
to O
order O
completion O

. O
Role O
and O
Responsibilities O
: O
• O

a O

test O
on O
the O
application O
and O
working O
on O

the O
test O
environment O
for O
smooth O
testing O
activities O
everyday O

. O
• O

and O

reports O
to O

by O

. O
• O

Present O
BT O
Openreach O
( O
British O
Telecom O
) O
BT O
Openreach O
is O
responsible O
for O
looking O
after O
the O
local O
network O
( O
connection O
from O
your O
property O
to O
local O
exchange O
) O
that O
makes O
the O
running O
of O
telecommunication O
services O
possible O
. O
BT O
helps O
to O
provide O
lines O
for O
telephone O
connection O
. O
It O
has O
products O
like O
PSTN O
, O
Ethernet O
, O
NGA O
, O
and O
LLU O
. O
BT O
acts O
as O
an O
intermediate O
between O
customer O
and O
connection O
provider O
. O
BT O
Openreach O
is O
a O
software O
module O
which O
manages O
BT O
business O
right O
from O
the O
placement O
of O
the O
order O
, O
managing O
appointments O
, O
monitoring O
status O
to O
order O
completion O
. O

and O
Responsibilities O
: O

test O

application O

PROJECT O
TITLE O
: O
Memory O
Bounded O
Anytime O
Heuristic O
Search O
A O
* O
Algorithm O
➢ O
This O
Project O
presents O
a O
heuristic O
- O
search O
algorithm O
called O
Memory O
- O
bounded O
Anytime O
Window O
A*(MAWA O
* O
) O
, O
which O
is O
complete O
, O
anytime O
, O
and O
memory O
bounded O

. O
MAWA O
* O
uses O
the O
window- O
bounded O
anytime O
- O
search O
methodology O
of O
AWA O
* O
as O
the O
basic O
framework O
and O
combines O
it O
with O
the O
memory O
- O
bounded O
A O
* O
-like O
approach O
to O
handle O
restricted O
memory O
situations O

. O
Simple O
and O
efficient O
versions O
of O

* O

for O

search O
have O

been O
presented O

. O

of O

show O

Description O
: O
CBIL O
( O
Core O
Banking O
Integration O
Layer O
) O
is O
a O
crucial O
integration O
layer O
that O
is O
specifically O
addressing O
the O
architectural O
complexity O
due O
to O
multiple O
core O
banking O
systems O
and O
variants O
at O
HSBC O

. O
It O
is O
a O
standard O
service O
interface O
across O
different O
core O
banking O
systems O
to O
facilitate O
easy O
integration O
with O
other O
global O
systems O

. O
CBIL O
is O
a O
strategic O
initiative O
to O
standardize O
all O
interfaces O
with O
core O
banking O
without O
impacting O
the O
underlying O
core O
banking O
system O

. O

BCWeb O
Wrap O
Migration O
to O
Windows O
Azure -
Client -
: O
Microsoft O
Corporation O
/ O
Group O
: O
VLIT O
Jan O
2011 O
- O
Oct O
2011 O
Case O
Study O
Featured O
on O
TechNet O
Synopsis O
: O
BCWeb O
is O
a O
Windows O
Azure O
ASP.NET O
Web O
Role O
application O
; O
authenticated O
against O
STS O
using O
Federation O
services O
that O
provide O
a O
set O
of O
Web O
forms O
that O
help O
capture O
price O
exception O
details O
, O
information O
on O
business O
case O
for O
doing O
discounts O
on O
price O
lists O
, O
and O
helps O
calculate O
percentage O
of O
discount O

. O
It O
uses O
the O
ASP.NET O
connector O
and O
custom O
Web O
services O
to O
pull O
real O
- O
time O
price O
information O
from O
SAP O
, O
and O
provides O
sales O
executives O
with O
a O
light O
front O
- O
end O
to O
SAP O

. O
BCWeb O
helps O
simulate O
pricing O
discounts O
, O
manage O
business O
rules O
, O
customize O
routing O
and O
approval O
workflows O
, O
and O
update O
the O
LOB O
data O
stored O
in O
SAP O

. O
One O
of O
the O
major O
goals O
of O
this O
system O
is O
to O
improve O
field O
productivity O
by O
simplifying O
the O
process O
and O
removing O
training O
requirements O
for O
complex O
back O
- O
end O
systems O
, O
in O
this O
case O
SAP O

. O
BCWeb O
integrates O
different O
promotion O
types O
into O
a O
simplified O
Web O
- O
application O

. O
It O
also O
allows O
users O
to O
specify O
business O
rules O
using O
Excel O
2007 O
files O
and O
to O
get O
notifications O
in O
Outlook O
2007 O

. O
Additional O
goals O
of O
this O
system O
include O
: O
• O
Reduce O
revenue O
leakage O
by O
having O
a O
business O
case O
documented O
for O
each O
promotion O
field O

. O
• O
Obtain O
visibility O
decisions O
and O
understand O
who O
required O
a O
discount O
and O
why O

. O
• O
Understand O
promotion O
effectiveness O
and O
ensure O
the O
field O
is O
making O
informed O
decisions O

. O
• O
Provide O
a O

set O
of O
files O
to O
easily O
change O
empowerment O
guidelines O
by O
having O
a O
single O
master O
data O
of O
workflow O
routing O
and O
approvals O

. O
• O
Specific O
business O
process O
in O
price O
- O
execution O
domain O
, O
however O
, O
pattern O
addresses O
larger O
solutions O
space O

. O
* O

: O

◦ O
Key O
Contributor O
as O
Windows O
Azure O
Developer O
, O
Analyst O
Origin O
Digital O
Cloud O
Coder O
Client O
: O
Origin O
Digital O
Jan O
2010 O
- O
May O
2010 O
Featured O
on O
MSDN O
Synopsis O
: O
Origin O
Digital O
, O
a O
video O
application O
service O
provider O
that O
aggregates O
, O
transcodes O
, O
manages O
and O
distributes O
the O
digital O
media O
files O

. O
As O
part O
of O
the O
business O
need O
, O
they O
wanted O
to O
increase O
transcoding O
throughput O
without O
increasing O
capital O
expense O

. O
As O
part O
of O
the O
solutioning O
, O
the O
onshore O
technical O
architect O
along O
with O
IDC O
development O
team O
put O
together O
an O
approach O
that O
allowed O
- O
Process O
intensive O
digital O
video O
transcoding O
service O
to O
- O
run O
- O
on O
Azure O
Platform O
leveraging O
cloud O
's O
real O
- O
time O
scalability O
and O
compute O
capacity O

. O
Infrastructure O
as O
a O
Service O
( O
IaaS O
) O
offering O

. O
- O
Secure O
all O
business O
sensitive O
information O
by O
using O
On O
- O
premise O
data O
storage O
through O
Azure O
- O
An O
administration O
module O
to O
support O
Platform O
as O
a O
Service O
( O
PaaS O
) O
was O
developed O

. O
The O
team O
completed O
the O
whole O
migration O
activity O
in O
6 O
weeks O
using O
Agile O
methodology O
and O
managed O
to O
showcase O
it O
successfully -
in O
Microsoft O
PDC O
2009 O
at O
Los O
Angeles O

. O
The O
solution O
resulted O
in O
reducing O
the O
compute O
costs O
by O
half O

. O
* O
Technologies O
used O
: O
ASP.Net O
3.5 O
, O
SQL O
Azure O
, O
Windows O

, O

/ O

, O

etc O

. O
* O
Roles O

for O

Insurance O


• O

by O

for O

field O
. O

• O

. O

• O

. O

to O

by O

of O

and O

. O

• O

business O
process O
in O

- O

, O

, O

addresses O

Coder O
Client O
: O
Origin O

Jan O
2010 O
- O

2010 O
Featured O
on O
MSDN O
Synopsis O
: O
Origin O
Digital O
, O
a O

application O
service O
provider O
that O

, O
transcodes O
, O

and O
distributes O
the O

media O
files O
. O
As O

- O

- O

. O
Infrastructure O
as O

( O

) O

. O
- O

- O

Azure O
- O

Platform O
as O

( O

) O

. O

in O
6 O
weeks O

and O
managed O
to O

in O

. O
The O

in O

. O

months O
. O

process O
starts O

DU O
Lead O

employee O
for O
onsite O

employee O

Project O
: O
Alert O
messaging O
is O
the O
process O
of O
reliably O
and O
securely O
circulating O
messages O
associated O
with O
an O
event O
to O
interested O
users O

. O
Due O
to O
the O
growth O
of O
Information O
Technology O
( O
IT O
) O
and O
telecommunications O
sectors O
in O
the O
recent O
past O
, O
the O
dissemination O
of O
alert O
messages O
has O
become O
prompt O
and O
easier O

. O
Since O
the O
existing O
business O
environment O
faces O
the O
challenge O
of O
reaching O
increasingly O
segmented O
markets O
, O
the O
design O
, O
delivery O
, O
and O
analysis O
of O
business O
communications O
needs O
to O
be O
tightly O
integrated O
across O
multiple O
alert O
notification O
channels O

. O
Telecommunication O
channels O
through O
which O
subscribers O
can O
receive O
alert O
messages O
may O
include O
email O
, O
fax O
, O
text O
messaging O
, O
instant O
messaging O
, O
broadband O
network O
and O
the O
like O

. O
Due O
to O
myriad O
software O
applications O
implemented O
by O
businesses O
and O
the O
vast O
demographics O
of O
customers O
, O
it O
may O
become O
necessary O
to O
segment O
alert O
messages O
so O
that O
the O
messages O
can O
be O
sent O
through O
channels O
based O
on O
business O
needs O
as O
well O
as O
customer O
preferences O

. O
Further O
, O
in O
order O
to O
maintain O
strong O
customer O
relationships O
, O
businesses O
need O
to O
time O
the O
messages O
precisely O

. O
This O
brief O
illustrates O
how O
Alert O
Notification O
System O
( O
IANS O
) O
can O
help O
organization O
leverage O
existing O
infrastructure O
to O
better O
service O
their O
customers O

. O

: O

a O

for O

e O

Project O
: O
Alert O
messaging O
is O
the O
process O
of O
reliably O
and O
securely O
circulating O
messages O
associated O
with O
an O
event O
to O

users O
. O
Due O

of O
Information O
Technology O
( O
IT O
) O
and O
telecommunications O
sectors O
in O
the O
recent O
past O
, O
the O
dissemination O
of O
alert O
messages O
has O
become O
prompt O
and O
easier O
. O
Since O
the O
existing O
business O
environment O
faces O
the O
challenge O
of O
reaching O
increasingly O
segmented O
markets O
, O
the O
design O
, O
delivery O
, O
and O
analysis O
of O
business O
communications O
needs O
to O
be O
tightly O
integrated O
across O
multiple O
alert O
notification O
channels O
. O
Telecommunication O
channels O
through O
which O
subscribers O
can O
receive O
alert O
messages O
may O
include O
email O
, O
fax O
, O
text O
messaging O
, O
instant O
messaging O
, O
broadband O
network O
and O
the O
like O
. O
Due O
to O
myriad O
software O
applications O
implemented O
by O
businesses O
and O
the O
vast O
demographics O
of O
customers O
, O
it O
may O
become O
necessary O
to O
segment O
alert O
messages O
so O
that O
the O
messages O
can O
be O
sent O
through O
channels O
based O
on O
business O
needs O
as O
well O
as O
customer O
preferences O
. O
Further O
, O
in O
order O
to O
maintain O
strong O
customer O
relationships O
, O
businesses O
need O
to O
time O
the O
messages O
precisely O
. O
This O
brief O
illustrates O
how O
Alert O
Notification O
System O
( O
IANS O
) O
can O
help O
organization O
leverage O
existing O
infrastructure O
to O
better O
service O
their O
customers O
. O

Description O
: O
Development O
of O
Basel O
II O
Application O
, O
Basel O
II O
is O
the O
second O
of O
the O
Basel O
Accords O
, O
which O
are O
recommendations O
on O
banking O
laws O
and O
regulations O
issued O
by O
the O
Basel O
Committee O
on O
Banking O
Supervision O

. O
The O
purpose O
of O
Basel O
II O
, O
which O
was O
initially O
published O
in O
June O
2004 O
, O
is O
to O
create O
an O
international O
standard O
that O
banking O
regulators O
can O
use O
when O
creating O
regulations O
about O
how O
much O
capital O
banks O
need O
to O
put O
aside O
to O
guard O
against O
the O
types O
of O
financial O
and O
operational O
risks O
banks O
face O

. O
In O
practice O
, O
Basel O
II O
attempts O
to O
accomplish O
this O
by O
setting O
up O
rigorous O
risk O
and O
capital O
management O
requirements O
designed O
to O
ensure O
that O
a O
bank O
holds O
capital O
reserves O
appropriate O
to O
the O
risk O
the O
bank O
exposes O
itself O
to O
through O
its O
lending O
and O
investment O
practices O

. O
The O
New O
Accord O
includes O
several O
methodologies O
for O
determining O
a O
bank O
's O
risk O
- O
based O
capital O
requirements O
for O
credit O
, O
market O
and O
operational O
risk O

. O
For O
Risk O
Based O
Capital O
( O
RBC O
) O
, O
Credit O
Usage O
( O
CU O
) O
and O
Stress O
Test O
( O
ST O
) O
, O
the O
methodologies O
that O
will O
be O
used O
for O
repo O
style O
transactions O
are O
Simple O
VaR O
if O
the O
collateral O
is O
eligible O

. O
If O
the O
collateral O
is O
ineligible O
then O
the O
Wholesale O
loan O
approach O
will O
be O
utilized O
or O
the O
collateral O
will O
be O
reduced O
to O
zero O
in O
the O
Simple O
VaR. O

. O
Roles O
and O
Responsibilities O
: O
Development O
, O
Testing O
and O
support O

. O
Software O
Used O
: O
Oracle O
9i O
OTHER O
PROJECTS O
AND O
REAL O
TIME O
TRAINING O
: O

Mobile O
) O

TITLE O
: O
Memory O
Bounded O
Anytime O
Heuristic O
Search O
A O
* O
Algorithm O
➢ O
This O
Project O

- O
search O
algorithm O
called O
Memory O
- O
bounded O
Anytime O
Window O
A*(MAWA O
* O
) O
, O
which O
is O
complete O
, O
anytime O
, O
and O
memory O
bounded O

. O
MAWA O
* O
uses O
the O
window- O
bounded O
anytime O
- O
search O
methodology O
of O
AWA O
* O
as O
the O
basic O
framework O

the O
memory O
- O
bounded O
A O
* O
-like O

to O

requirements O
. O

loss O

Project O
: O
Alert O
messaging O
is O
the O
process O
of O
reliably O
and O
securely O
circulating O
messages O
associated O
with O
an O
event O
to O
interested O
users O

. O
Due O
to O
the O
growth O
of O
Information O
Technology O
( O
IT O
) O
and O
telecommunications O
sectors O
in O
the O
recent O
past O
, O
the O
dissemination O
of O
alert O
messages O
has O
become O
prompt O
and O
easier O

. O
Since O
the O
existing O
business O
environment O
faces O
the O
challenge O
of O
reaching O
increasingly O
segmented O
markets O
, O
the O
design O
, O
delivery O
, O
and O
analysis O
of O
business O
communications O
needs O
to O
be O
tightly O
integrated O
across O
multiple O
alert O
notification O
channels O

. O
Telecommunication O
channels O
through O
which O
subscribers O
can O
receive O
alert O
messages O
may O
include O
email O
, O
fax O
, O
text O
messaging O
, O
instant O
messaging O
, O
broadband O
network O
and O
the O
like O

. O
Due O
to O
myriad O
software O
applications O
implemented O
by O
businesses O
and O
the O
vast O
demographics O
of O
customers O
, O
it O
may O
become O
necessary O
to O
segment O
alert O
messages O
so O
that O
the O
messages O
can O
be O
sent O
through O
channels O
based O
on O
business O
needs O
as O
well O
as O
customer O
preferences O

. O
Further O
, O
in O
order O
to O
maintain O
strong O
customer O
relationships O
, O
businesses O
need O
to O
time O
the O
messages O
precisely O

. O
This O
brief O
illustrates O
how O
Alert O
Notification O
System O
( O
IANS O
) O
can O
help O
organization O
leverage O
existing O
infrastructure O
to O
better O
service O
their O
customers O

. O

: O

certificates O

for O

e O

Project O
: O
Alert O
messaging O
is O
the O
process O
of O
reliably O
and O
securely O
circulating O
messages O
associated O
with O
an O
event O
to O
interested O
users O
. O
Due O
to O
the O
growth O
of O
Information O
Technology O
( O
IT O
) O
and O
telecommunications O
sectors O
in O
the O
recent O
past O
, O
the O
dissemination O
of O
alert O
messages O
has O
become O
prompt O
and O
easier O
. O
Since O
the O
existing O
business O
environment O
faces O
the O
challenge O
of O
reaching O
increasingly O
segmented O
markets O
, O
the O
design O
, O
delivery O
, O
and O
analysis O
of O
business O
communications O
needs O
to O
be O
tightly O
integrated O
across O
multiple O
alert O
notification O
channels O
. O
Telecommunication O
channels O
through O
which O
subscribers O
can O
receive O
alert O
messages O
may O
include O
email O
, O
fax O
, O
text O
messaging O
, O
instant O
messaging O
, O
broadband O
network O
and O
the O
like O
. O
Due O
to O
myriad O
software O
applications O
implemented O
by O
businesses O
and O
the O
vast O
demographics O
of O
customers O
, O
it O
may O
become O
necessary O
to O
segment O
alert O
messages O
so O
that O
the O
messages O
can O
be O
sent O
through O
channels O
based O
on O
business O
needs O
as O
well O
as O
customer O
preferences O
. O
Further O
, O
in O
order O
to O
maintain O
strong O
customer O
relationships O
, O
businesses O
need O
to O
time O
the O
messages O
precisely O
. O
This O
brief O
illustrates O
how O
Alert O
Notification O
System O
( O
IANS O
) O
can O
help O
organization O
leverage O
existing O
infrastructure O
to O
better O
service O
their O
customers O
. O

: O

a O
performance O
certificates O
and O
given O
a O
bonus O
for O
outstanding O
performance O

Post O

life O

Associate B-Designation

This O
project O
is O
actually O
a O
redesign O
of O
an O
existing O
client O
website O

. O
The O
client O
website O
was O
designed O
on O
Java O
Server O
Pages O
( O
JSP O
) O
and O
our O
aim O
was O
to O
change O
it O
into O
a O
more O
dynamic O
web O
page O
using O
Adobe O
Flex O

. O
At O
first O
we O
changed O
the O
home O
page O
screen O
of O
the O
client O
website O

. O
After O
the O
successful O
completion O
of O
that O
we O
incorporated O
flex O
in O
to O
the O
account O
section O
also O

. O
This O
data O
which O
is O
obtained O
from O
DataBase O
is O
taken O
by O
the O
flex O
using O
a O
remote O
procedure O
call O
and O
the O
data O
is O
shown O
to O
the O
user O

. O
With O
the O
use O
of O
Advanced O
Data O
Grids O
, O
Charts(including O
Bar O
and O
Pie O
Charts O
) O
the O
site O
increased O
the O
readability O
and O
understandability O
of O
the O
users O
who O
were O
previously O
using O
the O
pages O
on O
java O
server O
pages O

. O
This O
site O
developed O
by O
us O
won O
the O
IMC O
( O
Interactive O
Media O
Council O
) O
's O
outstanding O
achievement O
award O
in O
Financial O
information O

. O
The O
judge O
evaluate O
website O
based O
on O
5 O
criteria O
: O
Design O
, O
Content O
, O
Feature O
Functionality O
, O
Usability O
and O
Standard O
Compliance O

. O
Our O
website O
scored O
475 O
out O
of O
a O
maximum O
of O
500 O
points O

. O

Description O
: O
Development O
of O
Basel O
II O
Application O
, O
Basel O
II O
is O
the O
second O
of O
the O
Basel O
Accords O
, O
which O
are O
recommendations O
on O
banking O
laws O
and O
regulations O
issued O
by O
the O
Basel O
Committee O
on O
Banking O
Supervision O

. O
The O
purpose O
of O
Basel O
II O
, O
which O
was O
initially O
published O
in O
June O
2004 O
, O
is O
to O
create O
an O
international O
standard O
that O
banking O
regulators O
can O
use O
when O
creating O
regulations O
about O
how O
much O
capital O
banks O
need O
to O
put O
aside O
to O
guard O
against O
the O
types O
of O
financial O
and O
operational O
risks O
banks O
face O

. O
In O
practice O
, O
Basel O
II O
attempts O
to O
accomplish O
this O
by O
setting O
up O
rigorous O
risk O
and O
capital O
management O
requirements O
designed O
to O
ensure O
that O
a O
bank O
holds O
capital O
reserves O
appropriate O
to O
the O
risk O
the O
bank O
exposes O
itself O
to O
through O
its O
lending O
and O
investment O
practices O

. O
The O
New O
Accord O
includes O
several O
methodologies O
for O
determining O
a O
bank O
's O
risk O
- O
based O
capital O
requirements O
for O
credit O
, O
market O
and O
operational O
risk O

. O
For O
Risk O
Based O
Capital O
( O
RBC O
) O
, O
Credit O
Usage O
( O
CU O
) O
and O
Stress O
Test O
( O
ST O
) O
, O
the O
methodologies O
that O
will O
be O
used O
for O
repo O
style O
transactions O
are O
Simple O
VaR O
if O
the O
collateral O
is O
eligible O

. O
If O
the O
collateral O
is O
ineligible O
then O
the O
Wholesale O
loan O
approach O
will O
be O
utilized O
or O
the O
collateral O
will O
be O
reduced O
to O
zero O
in O
the O
Simple O
VaR. O

. O
Roles O
and O
Responsibilities O
: O
Development O
, O
Testing O
and O
support O

. O
Software O
Used O
: O
Oracle O
9i O
OTHER O
PROJECTS O
AND O
REAL O
TIME O
TRAINING O
: O
RTRM(Railway O
Ticketing O
System O
Through O
Mobile O
) O
A O
mobile O
based O
real O
time O
application O
with O
many O
exciting O
features O
like O
checking O
pnr O
status O
, O
train O
availability O
, O
trains O
between O
stations O
etc O

. O
This O
application O
was O
done O
in O
j2me O
and O
it O
uses O
weblogic O
as O
server O
and O
MSSQL O
as O
the O
database O

. O

PUBLICATIONS O
Post O
- O
operative O
life O
expectancy O
in O
lung O
cancer O
patients O
The O
objective O
of O
the O
project O
was O
to O
build O

efficient O

model O
based O
on O
a O
predefined O
dataset O
to O
predict O
whether O
the O
patient O
survives O
or O
dies O
within O
one O
year O
of O
the O
operation O

. O

dataset O
given O

variables O

nominal O

2 O

3 O
numerical O

. O

value O
true O
if O
the O
patient O
dies O
within O
one O
year O
of O
the O
operation O
else O

if O

survives O

. O
